page.title: 04Ecology Eastcotts
page.content: It is noticeable that the fields in this area are reasonably small by todays standards. The hedges are well kept, thick and well managed which helps to provide shelter for small mammals and birds. In some of the fields small copses have been allowed to remain; farmers have ploughed around them. These areas again afford shelter to the wildlife. However, one can still find evidence of the dutch elm plague which invaded a few years ago. Several skeleton trees remain standing today. Many footpaths and bridleways criss-cross over this land, both across fields and through the woods. These paths afford their users beautiful walks with lovely views and an abundance of flora and fauna to enjoy.
